verses.roman:
ākāra svabhāva-bhede vraja-devī-gaṇa
kāya-vyūha-rūpa tāṅra rasera kāraṇa

synonyms: ākāra—of features; svabhāva—of natures; bhede—with differences; vraja-devī-gaṇa—the gopīs; kāya—of Her body; vyūha—of expansions; rūpa—having the form; tāṅra—of Her; rasera—of mellows; kāraṇa—instruments.
translation: The Vraja-devīs have diverse bodily features. They are Her expansions and are the instruments for expanding rasa.
